com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.container

Class InterceptorComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.container.InterceptorComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WebComponent, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AjaxErrorInterceptor, AjaxInterceptor, AjaxPageShellInterceptor, AjaxSetupInterceptor, ContextCleanupInterceptor, DataListInterceptor, DebugStructureInterceptor, FormInterceptor, HeadLineInterceptor, PageShellInterceptor, ResponseCacheInterceptor, SessionTokenAjaxInterceptor, SessionTokenContentInterceptor, SessionTokenInterceptor, SubordinateControlInterceptor, TargetableErrorInterceptor, TargetableInterceptor, TransformXMLInterceptor, UIContextDumpInterceptor, ValidateXMLInterceptor, VelocityInterceptor, WhitespaceFilterInterceptor, WrongStepAjaxInterceptor, WrongStepContentInterceptor, WrongStepServerInterceptor, WWindowInterceptor

    public class InterceptorComponent
extends Object
implements WebComponent

    Interceptor components are used to plug in features to a container that is serving WComponents. Interceptor components can be chained together. The last component in the chain is normally the WComponent (UI) that is being served up.

    A new interceptor chain is created for each request that is served, so interceptors do not need to be thread safe. Note that in a Portal environment, the action and render phases will have separate interceptor chain instances.

    Author:
    Martin Shevchenko
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • replaceInterceptor

        public static InterceptorComponent replaceInterceptor(Class match,
                                                      InterceptorComponent replacement,
                                                      InterceptorComponent chain)
        Utility method for replacing an individual interceptor within an existing chain.
        Parameters:
        match - the type of the interceptor to be replaced.
        replacement - the new interceptor to be used as a replacement.
        chain - the existing interceptor chain in which the replacement will take place.
        Returns:
        the modified interceptor chain. If no match was found, the existing interceptor chain is returned unchanged.

        Deprecated. no longer used. use getId() instead.
        Subclasses can override. By default it delegates to the next interceptor in the chain.
